channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Google scrubs mentions of ‘diversity’ and ‘equity’ from responsible AI team webpage
item.description: Google has quietly updated the webpage for its Responsible AI and Human Centered Technology (RAI-HCT) team, the team charged with conducting research ...

item.title: Judge allows authors’ AI copyright lawsuit against Meta to move forward
item.description: A federal judge is allowing an AI-related copyright lawsuit against Meta to move forward, although he dismissed part of the suit. In Kadrey vs. Meta, ...

item.title: How to Get Windows Games Working on a Mac
item.description: If the game you want to play is only available for Windows, here are three things you can try to get it running on your Mac.

item.title: This Split Mattress Topper Made for Partners Who Can’t Agree
item.description: If you and your partner have different sleeping styles and debate over how soft or firm a mattress should be, the answer is this split topper.

item.title: 9 US AI startups have raised $100M or more in 2025
item.description: Last year was a monumental year for the AI industry in the U.S. and beyond. There were 49 startups that raised funding rounds worth $100 million or mo...

item.title: Comfort Colors T-Shirts Are the Only Thing I’ll Wear
item.description: I happened upon the budget brand at a chintzy souvenir shop in Maine. I've since sworn full allegiance to the cult of Comfort Colors.

item.title: The Extreme Weather Conditions That Drove the Carolina Wildfires
item.description: The wildifires in the Carolinas have followed months of whiplash weather—drought, followed by hurricane-fueled floods, and then more drought.

item.title: Week in Review: OpenAI could charge $20K a month for an AI agent
item.description: Welcome back to Week in Review. This week we’re looking at OpenAI potentially charging $20,000 a month for a specialized AI agent, the unexpected retu...

item.title: New DOJ proposal still calls for Google to divest Chrome, but allows for AI investments
item.description: The US Department of Justice is still calling for Google to sell its web browser Chrome, according to a Friday court filing. The DOJ first proposed th...

item.title: How to Clean Vinyl Records (2025): Vacuums, Solution, Wipes
item.description: Those clicks and pops aren't supposed to be there! Give your music a bath with this handy guide.
